senses.de: The part that is left when other parts have been taken away, used, or removed.
senses.ex: After the party, the remainder of the cake was stored in the fridge.

Tips.title: Left Behind
Tips.description: Use 'remainder' to describe something left after parts are removed, often unwanted or surplus.
Tips.example: We packed the leftovers, leaving only the remainder to dispose of.

Tips.title: Time Remaining
Tips.description: 'The remainder of the day' often implies a significant portion of time left.
Tips.example: He spent the remainder of the day relaxing.

Tips.title: Final Part
Tips.description: Used for the last part of something when its end is near.
Tips.example: In the remainder of her speech, she thanked her team.

senses.de: In mathematics, the amount left over when one quantity cannot be exactly divided by another.
senses.ex: In the division 17 ÷ 5, the quotient is 3 and the remainder is 2.

Tips.title: Exact Division
Tips.description: When quantities don't divide evenly, 'remainder' describes the amount left.
Tips.example: Dividing 15 by 4 gives a remainder of 3.

Tips.title: No Remainder
Tips.description: If a number divides evenly, we often say there is 'no remainder'.
Tips.example: 20 divided by 5 is exactly 4, with no remainder.

Tips.title: Nonzero Remainder
Tips.description: In math, a 'remainder' must be smaller than the divisor and nonzero.
Tips.example: When dividing 22 by 6, the remainder is 4.

senses.de: A book that is left unsold when it is no longer new and desirable.
senses.ex: The store was selling remainders from last year's best-seller list at discounted prices.

Tips.title: Discounted Books
Tips.description: 'Remainder' can refer to unsold books sold at a lower price.
Tips.example: I found this novel on the remainder shelf for half price.

Tips.title: Marketing Tactics
Tips.description: Remainders may be marketed as 'discounted' or 'bargain books'.
Tips.example: They put bright stickers on books for remainder sales.

Balance.wordDefinition:
Balance refers to the amount of money that is remaining in an account after all debits and credits have been accounted for.

For example, if you have $100 in your bank account and you spend $25, your balance would be $75.

Balance is applicable in the context of finances, while remainder is applicable in the context of mathematical operations.

Remain.wordDefinition:
Remain means what is left after something has been removed or used up. For example, if you have a pizza and you eat three slices, the remaining slices would be whatever is left over.

Remainder refers to the part that is left over after something has been divided or shared. For example, if you have 10 apples and you give away 4, the remainder would be 6.

Remain is used when something has already been consumed or removed, while remainder is used when something has been divided or shared.

Remnant.wordDefinition:
Remnant refers to a small remaining piece of something that has been largely used up or destroyed. For example, if you have a piece of fabric and you cut out a large section for a project, the remaining small piece would be a remnant.

So, in short, remainder is used when something is left over after division or subtraction, while remnant is used when something has been largely used up or destroyed and only a small piece remains.

Residue.wordDefinition:
Residue is generally used in a mathematical context to mean the part of a solution that is left over after removing something else.

For example, in algebra, sometimes one has to remove a certain factor or term from an equation to solve it. The residue, then, would be the solution once that factor or term has been removed.

A remainder refers to what is left over after a basic calculation or operation, while a residue is typically used in more complex mathematical situations to refer to the solution or part of the solution that remains after some element has been removed.

Rest.wordDefinition:
Rest refers to what is left over or remaining of a whole when some part has been removed.

It can be used in a variety of contexts, but often refers to physical objects or actions. For example, if you eat a pizza but leave a slice on the plate, the rest of the pizza is what's left.

Remainder is used in math to represent what's left over after division, while rest is used as a more general term for what's left over after something has been taken away.

quotes.Text: My parents didn't know much science; in fact, they didn't know science at all. But they could recognize a science book when they saw it, and they spent a lot of time at bookstores, combing the remainder tables for science books to buy for me. I had one of the biggest libraries of any kid in school, built on books that cost 50 cents or a dollar.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.Text: Laws are the terms by which independent and isolated men united to form a society, once they tired of living in a perpetual state of war where the enjoyment of liberty was rendered useless by the uncertainty of its preservation. They sacrificed a portion of this liberty so that they could enjoy the remainder in security and peace.
quotes.Title: Italian Judge
quotes.Name: Cesare Beccaria

quotes.Text: I promise you that the time will come, if you have tattoos, that you will regret your actions. They cannot be washed off. They are permanent. Only by an expensive and painful process can they be removed. If you are tattooed, then probably for the remainder of your life you will carry it with you.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.Text: I have no intention of selling any more of the historical Apollo 11 items in my possession for the remainder of my life. I intend to pass a portion of these items on to my children and to loan the most important items for permanent display in suitable museums around the country.
quotes.Title: American Astronaut
quotes.Name: Buzz Aldrin

quotes.Text: You'll get the biggest bang for each buck by paying off the highest interest rate debt in your portfolio first, while making minimum payments on the remainder. It's called the avalanche method, and it gets you out of debt cheapest and fastest.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Jean Chatzky

quotes.Text: In all nations an exceptional man exists that compensates the deficiencies of the remainder. In those moments, when humanity is found collectively in a state of decadence, there always remain those exceptional beings as point of reference.
quotes.Title: Paraguayan Novelist
quotes.Name: Augusto Roa Bastos

quotes.Text: I was seeing everything through pain. I would roll out of bed and do my exercises. I had to do that to work out the remainder of the pain pills. I would drink coffee and go to the set and plunge myself so far into my work.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Dick York

quotes.Text: Many of the architects of the Vietnam War became near pariahs as they spent the remainder of their lives in the futile quest to explain away their decisions at the time.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Graydon Carter

quotes.Text: Find out how much God has given you and from it take what you need; the remainder is needed by others.
quotes.Title: Saint
quotes.Name: Saint Augustine

quotes.Text: Trust me: I've been travelling, making movies, and spending the remainder of my time at home.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Kajal Aggarwal
